document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the crab spider genus Epicadus Simon, 1895 (Arachnida: Araneae: Thomisidae) with notes on related genera of Stephanopinae Simon, 1895

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the crab spider genus Epicadus Simon, 1895 (Arachnida: Araneae: Thomisidae) with notes on related genera of Stephanopinae Simon, 1895

bibRefCitation.author: Mello-Leitao
bibRefCitation.refString: Mello-Leitao, C. F. (1932) Pequenas notas arachnologicas. Boletim do Museu Nacional do Rio de Janeiro, 8, 67 - 75.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Epicadus planus
Mello-Leitão, 1932 : 73
.
Roewer 1954 : 755
;
Brignoli 1983 : 604
; World Spider Catalog 2016 .
Epicadus nigronotatus
Mello-Leitão, 1940 : 213
. N ew synonymy.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. “ Planus ” is derived from the Latin word
planus
“flat”, and is an adjective.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type material: Holotype
of
Epicadus planus
(designated by Mello-Leitão 1932 ): female, BRAZIL ,
Bahia , Ilhéus
, [-14.81642, -39.033268], E.E. May leg. (
MNRJ 14205
; examined).

Holotype
of
Epicadus nigronotatus
(designated by Mello-Leitão 1940 ): female, BRAZIL , Espírito Santo , Goitacazes , FLONA Goitacazes , Linhares , [-19.396667, -40.061667], M. Rosa leg. (
MNRJ 58252
; examined).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Note. The original descriptions of both
E. planus
and
E. nigronotatus
were poor and lack any illustrations, and are based on intraspecifically variable characters (such as size and slight changes in the angle of opisthosomal projections) or on features also seen in other thomisid species. Upon study of the type specimens,
E. planus
and
E. nigronotatus
were found to be different only in size and intraspecific variations of the external morphology, which leads us to synonymize both species.

Diagnosis. Females of
E. planus
differ from the other two species by the discrete eye mount, without the vertical spiniform projections ( Fig. 11 D), truncated median posterior abdominal projection that ends in three smaller tips (1G, H, I, 11C, E), vestigial MS and by a line of black granules on the dorsum of the prosoma ( Figs 11 B, C) and five black spots on the opisthosoma, three dorsal and two posterior, between the upper and lower lateral projections. Males have a very discrete eye mount ( Fig. 13 D), opisthosomal sclerites larger than in
E. rubripes
and
E.heterogaster
( Fig. 13 E) and a distinct transversal line of black sclerites on the opisthosoma dorsum ( Fig. 13 A). Male palp in ventral view resemble those of
E. heterogaster
, with the tegular furrow at eight o’clock, but differ in both margins of RTA remarkably folded and in the DTA tip directed ventrally and forming a straight angle with the axis of the RTA ( Figs. 14 C, D; 15I ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11.
Epicadus planus Mello-Leitão, 1932
(holotype
of E. nigronotatus
, MNRJ 58252). A–C habitus (A dorsal, B lateral, C ventral); D cephalic, region frontal view; E opisthosoma, caudal view. Scale bars: 2 mm (A–C), 1 mm (D–E).

FIGURE 12.
Epicadus planus Mello-Leitão, 1932
(holotype of
E. nigronotatus
, MNRJ 58252). A–E Epigynum/vulva (A, E ventral—arrows point to CO, B anterior arrows points to FD, C–D dorsal—arrows in D point to FD. Scale bars: 0.2 mm (A, B, D), 0.5 mm (C, E).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Female (
E. nigronotatus
holotype , MNRJ 58252):
Total length 10.07 mm ; prosoma width 4.47; opisthosoma width 5.47; prosoma height without projections 2.47; opisthosoma height without projections 4.47. Legs measurements: femur I 4.53; patella I 2.63; tibia I 2.80; metatarsus I 2.13; tarsus I 1.47; femur II 4.70; patella II 2.03; tibia II 2.97; metatarsus II 2.07; tarsus II 1.60; femur III 2.60; patella III 0.77; tibia III 1.97; metatarsus III 1.27; tarsus III 0.67; femur IV 2.80; patella IV 1.33; tibia IV 1.87; metatarsus IV 1.93; tarsus IV 0.73. Leg spination: tibia I 2 -0-2-2; metatarsus I 2 -0-2-2ap; tibia II 2 -0-2-2; metatarsus II 2 -0-2-2ap (dorsal) 2-2 (retrolateral). Epigynum and genital features as in Fig. 12 .

Male ( MNRJ 11479):
Total length 2.75mm ; prosoma width 1.35mm ; opisthosoma width 1.56; prosoma height 0.78; opisthosoma height without projections1.19. Leg measurements: femur I 1.15; patella I 0.49; tibia I 0.74; metatarsus I 0.53. tarsus I 0.41; femur II 1.23; patella II 0.49; tibia II 0.62; metatarsus II 0.57; tarsus II 0.49; femur III 0.62; patella III 0.29; tibia III 0.41; metatarsus III 0.41; tarsus III 0.25; femur IV 0.78; patella IV 0.31; tibia IV 0.36; metatarsus IV 0.41. tarsus IV 0.25. Leg spination: tibia I 2-2 ; metatarsus I 2-2 ; tibia II 2-2 ; metatarsus II 2-2 - 2ap. Palp as in Fig. 14 .

Distribution. BOLIVIA : Beni ; BRAZIL : Amazonas ,
Bahia
, Espírito Santo , Mato Grosso , Mato Grosso do Sul , Paraná , Rio de Janeiro , Rio Grande do Sul , Roraima ;
MEXICO
:
San Luis Potosí
;
PANAMA
: Bocas Del Toro ( Fig. 20 ).
